The property itself has a lot of character and history. Lots of windows, natural lighting, and A/C units throughout the house. There is a half bathroom downstairs and a full bathroom upstairs. Living room was spacious, a table big enough to fit 5-6 people comfortably. Washer and dryer are in the garage and very easy to use. Didn’t use the patio or backyard but it seemed great too. Cable and internet worked great. Jen and Jim even had a charging station in the living room. There was one parking spot on their driveway. Not a big driveway, but fit my mid-size SUV just fine. Street parking is hit or miss. Usually not a problem until the evening when people return home. There are parking restrictions unless you had a residential permits but those restrictions weren’t being enforced because of the pandemic.
Overall, I would highly recommend. I would certainly return to Jen and Jim’s home when we return to Sacramento.

Lovely property, great location in town with a very private back yard. Check in and out was really easy and our hosts were very pleasant to work with.

Jen & Jim’s house was absolutely beautiful! They managed to find the sweet spot between modern touches and historic charm. The stay is exactly as described; you won’t be disappointed :) Looking forward to returning!

The wifi was solid; my wife and I were both able to take work videos calls and there were an array of streaming options on TV. It's the perfect place for your quiet vacation or work trip!

This Victorian house in midtown is the perfect place to stay while in Sacramento. Three very nice bedrooms with a beautiful kitchen and living area. A very walkable neighborhood and the hosts are very accommodating. Would absolutely stay here again.
